senses.synonym: 03997192-n (street names for marijuana);06648638-n (slang terms for inside information; \""is that the straight dope?\"");07944171-n (carbonated drink flavored with extract from kola nuts (`dope' is a southernism in the United States));10059116-n (an ignorant or foolish person);00084799-v (give a narcotic to; \""The athletes were dope by the coach before the race\"");00558099-v (add impurities to (a semiconductor) in order to produce or modify its properties; \""The resistors have been doped\"");01203444-v (take drugs to improve one's athletic performance

relations.target: surface=02691302-n (a device that provides reactive force when in motion relative to the surrounding air; can lift or control a plane in flight);04369112-n (the outer boundary of an artifact or a material layer constituting or resembling such a boundary; \""there is a special cleaner for these surfaces\""; \""the cloth had a pattern of red dots on a white surface\"");05620592-n (information that has become public; \""all the reports were out in the open\""; \""the facts had been brought to the surface\"");05862014-n (a superficial aspect as opposed to the real nature of something; \""it was not what it appeared to be on the surface\"");08677970-n (the extended two-dimensional outer boundary of a three-dimensional object; \""they skimmed over the surface of the water\""; \""a brush small enough to clean every dental surface\""; \""the sun has no distinct surface\"");09474647-n (the outermost level of the land or sea; \""earthquakes originate far below the surface\""; \""three quarters of the Earth's surface is covered by water\"");00424655-v (appear or become visible; make a showing; \""She turned up at the funeral\""; \""I hope the list key is going to surface again\"");01266847-v (put a coat on; cover the surface of; furnish with a surface; \""coat the cake with chocolate\"");01994295-v (come to the surface);02480566-a (on the surface; \""surface materials of the moon\""
lubricant=14914810-n (a substance capable of reducing friction by making surfaces smooth or slippery)

paste=07872246-n (a tasty mixture to be spread on bread or crackers or used in preparing other dishes);14729127-n (an adhesive made from water and flour or starch; used on paper and paperboard);14729448-n (any mixture of a soft and malleable consistency);14906399-n (a hard, brilliant lead glass that is used in making artificial jewelry);01334887-v (join or attach with or as if with glue; \""paste the sign on the wall\""; \""cut and paste the sentence in the text\"");01335281-v (cover the surface of; \""paste the wall with burlap\"");01415298-v (hit with the fists; \""He pasted his opponent\""

liquid=07134351-n (a frictionless continuant that is not a nasal consonant (especially `l' and `r'));14504004-n (the state in which a substance exhibits a characteristic readiness to flow with little or no tendency to disperse and relatively high incompressibility);14964238-n (fluid matter having no fixed shape but a fixed volume);14964524-n (a substance that is liquid at room temperature and pressure);00434168-a (clear and bright; \""the liquid air of a spring morning\""; \""eyes shining with a liquid luster\""; \""limpid blue eyes\"");00781576-a (in cash or easily convertible to cash; \""liquid (or fluid) assets\"");01143332-a (smooth and unconstrained in movement; \""a long, smooth stride\""; \""the fluid motion of a cat\""; \""the liquid grace of a ballerina\"");01508720-a (smooth and flowing in quality; entirely free of harshness; \""the liquid song of a robin\"");01509670-a (changed from a solid to a liquid state; \""rivers filled to overflowing by melted snow\"");02269142-a (existing as or having characteristics of a liquid; especially tending to flow; \""water and milk and blood are liquid substances\"");02482846-a (filled or brimming with tears; \""swimming eyes\""; \""sorrow made the eyes of many grow liquid\""
viscous=00053931-a (having the sticky properties of an adhesive);02425824-a (having a relatively high resistance to flow)

senses.definition: Any viscous liquid or paste, such as a lubricant, used in preparing a surface
